instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.D6990: What is D6990? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input, can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .
definitions.R6990: What is R6990? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on Macbooks from around the year 2012. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: so <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> seems to be shorted to ground i get a beep on my meter but when i inject voltage my power supply doesnt helkp me find it. must be too small of a short to be detected? what other tricks can i use?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
Beep is not equal short.
Which is the exact value, on diode scale; red probe to ground, also black to ground.
Usual DC multimeters beep until 060-075, which is not short at all...

Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42 voltage.
Do you get magsafe light?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3v42 are present with a green light on charger.

on <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> i get a beep at 23ohm and dropping

and on diode mode i get 0.013v on <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
That is low value, but insufficient to heat anything if inject voltage.
Confirm you are NOT measuring diode scale on powered board.
Also remember, always wait 15-20s after power removed, before do any continuity measure on board...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: Yeah as 2informaticos said disconnect power for 15-20 seconds then measure resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> again without power applied. If it's still short, inject 3.3 volts into that line. There should absolutely be current draw on a low resistance short might be hard to find it. You can increase amperage to 4 or 5 amps if you power supply allows it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message:
i was able to find some shorted components by leaving magsafe on while injecting voltage i replaced a couple components that went to the same line now i do get voltage on <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> but it fluctuates a lot. it goes as far back as <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR> on pin 2. Replaced <DIODE>D6990</DIODE> but no change <RESISTOR>R6990</RESISTOR> is at proper resistance no change.

removed smc but i still get fluctuation. bad pch?

any further ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: If you injected voltage with charger connected, probably the board is trash now...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: maybe, ill have to test it but i got it to turn on at least. <CHIP>U6610</CHIP> was shorting the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: Yeah never ever EVER inject voltage with the charger plugged in. This is prob dead now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> short to ground
threads.message: i guess i got lucky. board is working fine.
